column4: hi  can anyone tell me what the hardware requirements are for ubuntu  specifically how much ram is needed ??
512mb will let you run (barely) 768 and above is much better
if you've already burned them, there's a disk check option on the startup menu of the cd
basically cuz the disk has it's own checker in the startup menu. the md5sum check is done on the downloaded iso before you burn.
how do i check via cd   when i instert them into drive it shows contents  Does the machine need to be shut down and brought up with cd in drive ?
is this a vista machine you're going to install ubuntu on?
no i have ubuntu 6.04 LTS standalone now and want to upgrade the os
it really matters about what you downloaded: you can go directly from 6.04(6) to 8.04, but not to 8.10.
I would suggest going from 6.04 to 8.04, if you want to upgrade. However, you can back up your $HOME and do !clone to get your package list, then do a fresh 8.10 install. I'd slightly recommend that
what is that !clone to get package list ??
if i were to upgrade from 6.04 to 8.04 how would I do that?  Or is there an option on the 8.04 cd for that ?
when you insert the 8.04 disk into the machine while 6.04 is running, it should offer to upgrade
if it doesn't, try running    update-manager -c    in a terminal
would all the packages that I am currently using still remain in the upgrade ?
yes, it'll upgrade everything, from the kernel to openoffice
even stuff that has been dropped (that is, was in 6.04 but is not in 8.04) will stay on your machine.
